excellent.description: Created iOS app using ML to detect skin cancer from photos; 15K downloads, featured in TechCrunch; partnered with 3 dermatologists for clinical validation; open-sourced algorithm now used by 2 university research teams.

what_works: Specific, quantified impact (15K downloads, 3 dermatologists, 2 research teams)
Clear progression and depth (clinical validation, ongoing use)
annotations.notes: This is an exceptional activity that demonstrates entrepreneurship, technical skill, and real-world impact. The external validation (press, clinical partners) elevates it beyond a typical coding project.

excellent.description: Lead 45-volunteer tutoring program for Title I elementary students; grew from 12 to 180 students served weekly; implemented reading curriculum that improved average reading levels by 1.5 grades; trained new volunteer cohorts each semester.

what_works: Clear leadership role with specific scope (45 volunteers)
Shows both management and direct impact
annotations.notes: Strong service activity with clear growth trajectory and measurable outcomes. The combination of managing volunteers AND developing curriculum shows multifaceted contribution.

needs_work.description: Volunteered at food bank helping distribute food to families in need. Learned about food insecurity in my community. This experience taught me the importance of giving back.

problems: Vague description—what specifically did you do?
No quantified impact (how many families? how much food?)
No evidence of leadership or initiative
how_to_improve: Add specifics: 'Sorted 500+ lbs of donations weekly, served 50+ families each Saturday'
Show any initiative: 'Organized donation drive that collected 2,000 items'
Include progression: 'Trained as shift lead, now coordinate 8 volunteers'
Cut the generic reflection—use the space for concrete details
annotations.improved_version: Sorted 500+ lbs of donations weekly and distributed groceries to 75+ families each Saturday. Trained as shift lead after 6 months; now coordinate 8 volunteers per shift. Organized school donation drive collecting 2,000 items.
annotations.notes: Currently reads as basic participation. With the improved version, it moves toward Tier 3 by showing initiative and specific impact.

needs_work.description: Played varsity soccer for 4 years. Made varsity as a freshman which was a big accomplishment. We won the league championship junior year. Soccer taught me teamwork and dedication.

problems: Doesn't highlight individual role or contribution
Team achievement mentioned but no personal role in it
Position is just 'Member' despite 4 years—no captaincy, no leadership?
Wasted space on 'soccer taught me' reflection
how_to_improve: Specify position played and any role evolution
Add individual stats or recognition if any
Describe YOUR contribution to the championship
If no captaincy, show informal leadership
Use reflection space for concrete details instead
annotations.improved_version: Starting center midfielder all 4 years; 35 career assists, 2nd in school history. Selected team captain senior year; led pre-game strategy sessions. Key playmaker in league championship run junior year (4 assists in playoffs). Organize summer training sessions for teammates.
annotations.notes: The original description buries what could be a strong activity. If they have achievements, they need to show them. If they don't, they should focus on consistent commitment and any informal leadership.

excellent.description: Lead weekly practice sessions for 12-member team; placed 3rd at State MATHCOUNTS 8th grade. Created problem sets and mentored 6th graders joining the team.

what_works: Clear leadership role with specific duties
annotations.age_appropriate: Excellent for an 8th grader applying to high school. Shows academic passion, leadership emergence, and service to others.

excellent.description: Second violin in youth orchestra (by audition). Practice 1 hour daily, rehearsals every Saturday. Performed at Davies Symphony Hall last spring!

what_works: Genuine enthusiasm visible (exclamation point feels natural for age)
annotations.age_appropriate: Perfect for a 5th grader. Shows dedication, achieved something notable, but doesn't try to sound like a college applicant. The exclamation point is endearing, not inappropriate.

needs_work.description: I have been playing soccer since I was 4 years old. I love soccer because it teaches teamwork and discipline. I hope to continue playing in middle school.

problems: Generic description that doesn't tell us much
Reads like every other soccer description
how_to_improve: What do you love about it specifically?
Any goals or skills you've developed?
annotations.improved_version: Goalkeeper for my AYSO team for 3 years. I love diving for saves—even when I miss! Our team made the playoffs last fall. I practice juggling in my backyard and can do 47 in a row now.
annotations.notes: For middle school, personality matters more than achievements. The improved version shows genuine enthusiasm and specific details that make this kid memorable.

resume_speak.description: Using overly formal language that sounds like a job application
resume_speak.bad_example: Utilized strategic leadership capabilities to facilitate organizational growth and stakeholder engagement.
resume_speak.good_example: Led the club from 12 to 40 members by starting a weekly game night and Instagram page.
resume_speak.fix: Write like a human. Use simple, direct language. Be specific.

vague_impact.bad_example: Made a significant impact on the community through various volunteer activities.
vague_impact.good_example: Tutored 8 elementary students weekly; 5 improved their math grades by at least one letter.
vague_impact.fix: Quantify everything you can. Numbers are memorable and credible.

passive_participation.bad_example: Attended weekly meetings and participated in club activities.
passive_participation.good_example: Designed our annual fundraiser poster and managed the ticket sales spreadsheet.
passive_participation.fix: What did YOU do? What's different because you were there?

generic_reflection.description: Using the 150 characters for cliché lessons learned
generic_reflection.bad_example: This experience taught me valuable life lessons about perseverance and working with others.
generic_reflection.good_example: Organized 15-person camping trip; handled gear logistics, meal planning, and one minor bear encounter.
generic_reflection.fix: Skip the reflection. Use every character for concrete details. Admissions officers can infer the lessons.

list_of_activities.description: Cramming multiple activities into one entry
list_of_activities.bad_example: Member of French Club, Environmental Club, and Chess Club. Participated in various activities and events.
list_of_activities.good_example: Founded Environmental Club; led campus recycling program that diverted 500 lbs from landfill monthly.
list_of_activities.fix: One activity per entry. If you have extras, pick the ones with depth. Quality > quantity.
